meanings.definition: The state or quality of being willing.
meanings.sent1: Her willingnesses to help others always shines through.
meanings.sent2: The team showed great willingnesses to work together on the project.
meanings.sent3: His willingnesses to eat spicy food surprised everyone at the party.
meanings.sent4: The garden's flowers bloomed with the same brightness as her willingnesses to succeed.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's willingnesses to listen made the students feel valued.

meanings.definition: The act of being willing to do something.
meanings.sent1: Their willingnesses to participate in the charity event was heartwarming.
meanings.sent2: I admire your willingnesses to try new things.
meanings.sent3: The cat showed willingnesses to chase after the laser pointer.
meanings.sent4: The athlete's willingnesses to push through the pain led to victory.
meanings.sent5: The child's willingnesses to learn knew no bounds.
